data.text: Contents
Introduction

The Trust is committed to providing a staff residential accommodation service to assist in recruiting and retaining staff to support and enhance the delivery of healthcare services. The provision of residential accommodation is not the core business of the Trust and as such its role as accommodation provider (Landlord) should not compromise its position as employer.
This policy provides guidance on the management and allocation of Trust staff residential accommodation under Assured Shorthold Tenancy (“AST”) agreements.

It is not the responsibility of the Trust to offer long term or permanent housing. Accommodation will only be provided for a period which is deemed appropriate for the purposes of recruitment, retention or the specific requirements of the post.
Scope
The purpose of this policy is to outline arrangements for MSE staff with a requirement for accommodation;
Facilitates the running of clinical services for patients by assisting staff in securing local accommodation;
Assists staff recruitment and staff retention by providing safe and secure short term housing at affordable rents;
Provides accommodation for staff whom the Trust has a statutory and/or contractual obligation to house e.g. medical students;
Ensures fair and equitable allocation of available accommodation to eligible staff in support of health care delivery;
Assures compliance with legislation and with terms of short term tenancy agreement;
Supports efficient and appropriate use of residential accommodation
Outlines Trust Accommodation Department support service to new staff looking for private rental accommodation in the locality
Ensure the provision of staff residential accommodation that meets the
required objectives
Definitions

table_items.text: Staff residing in accommodation provided by the Trust upon payment of rent
Premises owner (the Trust) or external landlords
Support provision for private housing rental accommodation
Measure of UK inflation used for calculating annual rent uplift.

data.text: Role and responsibilities within the Trust
Committee responsibilities (i.e. Medicines Committees)
EFM Governance Board receive key performance indicator report on occupancy levels
The Chief Executive has overall responsibility for the implementation of this policy.
Managing Director ensures the Trust has an effective policy on Trust residential accommodation and has overall responsibility for the provision of a safe and secure environment for Tenants.
Senior Director of Estates and Facilities is responsible for ensuring this policy is implemented and monitored.

Estates and Facilities Site Manager is responsible for ensuring robust systems, processes and adequate resources are in place to provide suitable accommodations, and ensure the compliance to this policy.
MSE Senior Accommodation Manager is responsible for having an oversight for the full on-site accommodation provision.

Site EFM Accommodation Manager is responsible for the operational management of residential accommodation including liaison with line managers and Tenants and ensuring compliance with this policy and associated procedures. This includes allocation of accommodation, the provision of and adherence to short term tenancy agreements and issuing Notices Requiring Possession.
Head of Estate Portfolio Management is responsible for the sourcing and operational management of external leased properties.
All residents must have an awareness of and adhere to this policy.
Role letting arrangement
Any member of staff (or Tenant) taking up the offer of Trust accommodation after eligibility assessment will be required to enter into an Assured Short term Tenancy Agreement (‘AST') (Appendix 1).
The Landlord and Tenant must sign the AST which will form a binding legal contract between the parties.

The AST may be terminated early by mutual consent between the parties, however this cannot be before the initial 6 month period unless a Section 8 Notice is served by the Landlord, (pursuant to Section 8 the of the Housing Act 1988)
A minimum of four months' notice must be given by either party to end the AST after the initial 6 month period.
The Landlord will send a reminder of the AST end date to the Tenant in writing so that arrangements can be made for tenants to vacate the property by the required date.
Where the Trust deems it appropriate, an alternative form of occupancy agreement may be offered for shorter occupancies e.g. overnight, one week subject to availability.

In the event that a tenancy is agreed beyond the fixed term, a notice requiring possession of the property will be served on the Tenant with no less than 4 months' notice pursuant to Section  of the Housing Act 1988. Tenants will be required to vacate the property in the following circumstances:
At the end of a tenancy agreement;
On termination of employment
Where a tenancy agreement has been extended, on the last date of the extension;
If Tenant is in breach of the terms of the tenancy agreement regardless of the tenancy end date.
Eligibility
Requests for accommodation will be dealt with on receipt of an accommodation request form (Appendix 2) on a prioritised criteria basis and in accordance with locally agreed procedures.
Accommodation allocation prioritised criteria basis is as follows:
Priority 1: Junior doctors in training (FY1, FY2 )and medical students
Priority 2: Locum clinical staff who are providing short term cover e.g. up to 6 months
Priority 3: Staff retention and overseas recruitment initiatives, subject to availability, up to one month with discretion to extend for further month.
Priority 4: Students (all professions) who are accessing learning placements, subject to availability
Priority 5: Staff who will be unable to take up post without accommodation e.g. due to relocation, subject to availability

The Trust will offer accommodation to Junior Doctors (Foundation Year 1 and 2), Specialty and Core Trainees, Registrars, Medical Students, Locum Doctors and nurses being recruited from overseas. Subject to availability, accommodation may also be offered to other staff commencing work with the Trust and with the agreement of the relevant budget holder.
Extensions to tenancy agreements will only be granted by prior agreement with accommodation management, subject to availability of accommodation.
If the allocated accommodation is rejected by locum clinical staff it is the responsibility of the locum to find suitable alternative accommodation.

The Accommodation Department will provide housing advice and support on private housing rental accommodation in the locality for Junior Doctors, Locum staff considered to be eligible to be considered for staff housing, and to other new staff who otherwise would be unable to take up their post. This includes overseas recruits and students accessing learning placements.

Any requirement for accommodation that the Trust wishes to commit to that cannot be accommodated within available stock will need to be referred to the EFM Specialist services property portfolio management team for additional tenancy agreements from properties within the market to be sourced. The standard application process must be followed with all requests going through the MSE Accommodation Manager who will confirm there isn't available for the request being made either to a full or partial extent, the residual requirement is then passed on by the Accommodation Manager to the Portfolio Team who will make proposals for the requestor to accept or decline the additional cost. If additional property is let it becomes part of the MSET Trust accommodation property stock for the duration of the tenancy agreement with operational management through the operational team
with their resource, expertise and infrastructure extended in a way best placed to take on the additional management.
Rent charges and payments
Rental levels for accommodation provided by the Trust will not exceed market levels for comparable accommodation.

Rental levels will be reviewed and uplifted annually in line with Trust Tenancy agreement (AST) and current Retail Price Index (RPI) and authorised by the Chief Estates and Facilities Officer, following benchmarking of market rental levels by accommodation management to ensure the provisions are met.
It is the Tenants obligation to pay the rent on the days requested and in the manner as agreed in the Tenancy Agreement.
Standards of accommodation
Accommodation offered by the Trust will be local to the main Hospital site where possible.
The Trust reserves the right to make residential accommodation available through whatever means it deems appropriate from time to time, including the use of private landlords.
Shared accommodation will be of a standard that meets or exceeds those set down by the British Medical Association (HSC 2000/036 refers) unless amended by the Trust.
The Trust operates a strict Smoke Free Policy and this extends to all Trust residential accommodation.
Training requirements
No specific training requirements.
Monitoring and audit
Outlined below is the Trust's process of monitoring compliance with, and the effectiveness of the document's main points.

table_items.text: Aspect of compliance or effectiveness being monitored
Individual department responsible for the monitoring
Group / Committee / forum which will receive the findings/monitoring report
Committee / individual responsible for ensuring the actions are completed

data.text: Approval and implementation

All policies, procedures and guidelines will be approved by the EFM Governance Board, which is the specialist group with the authority to approve local policy and procedure guidelines. These will then be forwarded to the Document control team for submission and ratification by the Joint Document Management Group.
It is the author's responsibility to inform the EFM Governance Board of the approved policy documents when they are uploaded to the Trust's Intranets.
Equality impact assessment
The Trust is committed to the provision of a service that is fair, accessible and meets the needs of all individuals.
(Refer to appendix 3)
References

MID and SOUTH ESSEX HOSPITALS NHS FOUNDATION TRUST
ASSURED SHORTHOLD TENANCY AGREEMENT (SHARED ACCOMMODATION)
THE LANDLORD'S OBLIGATIONS The Landlord agrees: Possession
To grant the Tenant possession of the Property at the commencement of the tenancy Tenant's right to occupy

That the Tenant paying the rent and performing and observing all the agreements on the part of the Tenant contained in this Agreement may quietly possess and enjoy the Property during the tenancy hereby created without any lawful interruption from or by the Landlord or any person claiming through or under or in trust for it.
Comply with repairing obligations
To be liable for any repairs which are the responsibility of a lessor by virtue of Section 11 of the Landlord and Tenant Act 1985.
THE TENANT'S OBLIGATIONS The Tenant agrees: Possession and Occupation
To take possession of the Property at the commencement of the tenancy and to inform the Landlord if the Property is going to be left unoccupied for more than 14 days.
Rent
To pay the rent on the days and in the manner specified.
Deposit

The Tenant shall pay to the Landlord a security deposit on the signing of this Agreement. This deposit shall be retained in an approved government tenancy scheme within 30 days of collection. This acts as security for performance of the Tenant's obligations and shall be repayable to the Tenant only after the end of the tenancy, without interest and after any deductions of any sums required to compensate the Landlord whether wholly or in part for any breach of obligation on the Tenant's part.
Payment of Bills:
Where utility charges are separately charged, to pay all utility charges supplied to the Property promptly and in the manner specified.

To comply with any obligation arising under the relevant local government finance legislation or regulations made there under and (if appropriate) pay such contributions as may be notified by the Landlord, including Council Tax or any similar
Property tax that might be charged in addition to or replacement of it during the tenancy. Utilities and Services
To promptly pay for any charges, penalties or losses arising due to non-payment of utility bills. This shall include losses due to card meters being installed or conventional meters being removed.

Not to change the supplier of any utility supplied to the Property nor do anything to cause disconnection of any utility, telephone or any other service to the Property. The Tenant shall forward all correspondence addressed to the Landlord that arrives at the Property on to the Landlord's address without delay.
Not to tamper interfere with alter or add to the installations or meters relating to supply of utilities and services
Data

The Landlord may inform utility providers and other government and local government organisations of the Tenant's identity and forwarding details where this is considered to be necessary and in accordance with the Data Protection Act 1998. Use of Property

To use the Property for private residential purposes only as the Tenant's only or principal home and not to operate a business nor to use the Property in any way so as to endanger life or Property or for any improper, immoral or illegal purpose.
Smoking

Not to smoke or permit visitors to smoke anywhere inside the Property, communal areas or the grounds unless within dedicated external smoking areas. This includes vaping or smoking e-cigarettes. Where smoking has occurred and damage has been sustained to the interior of the Property or its contents, the Tenant is liable for the costs incurred by the Landlord in  having  all  damage  made  good  including  (but not limited  to)  having  any discoloured ceilings, walls, skirting boards, doors professionally redecorated and any curtains, furnishings, upholstery and carpets professionally cleaned or replaced.  Any such costs will be deducted from the security deposit and the monies due to the Tenant and any remaining sums owed by the Tenant to the Landlord will be recovered as a debt.
Nuisance
Not to cause or allow invited visitors to cause a nuisance or annoyance to the Landlord or to neighbours or other tenants of the Landlord.
Racial and other harassment

Not to commit or allow invited visitors to commit any form of harassment on the grounds of race colour religion sex sexuality disability or on any other grounds which may interfere with the peace and comfort of or cause offence to any other tenant or his or her visitors neighbours or the Landlord or any employee agent or contractor acting on behalf of the Landlord.
Noise

Not to play or allow to be played any radio, television, entertainment, audio equipment, multimedia devices or musical instrument at any time so loudly that it causes a nuisance or annoyance to neighbours, other adjoining residents or people in the immediate area or so that it can be heard outside the Property.
Animals
Not keep any animal in the Property.
Internal Condition

To keep the interior of the Property (including the internal face of external and internal walls and internal faces of windows and frames) and all fixtures fittings and household effects belonging to the Landlord or any other person in a good and clean condition
Damage
Not to cause any damage to the Property or the fixtures and fittings belonging to the Landlord or any furniture or household effects supplied by the Landlord or any other person.

To make good or pay for any damage to the Property or to fixtures and fittings furniture and household effects belonging to the Landlord or any other person or to the common parts caused by the Tenant or any member of the Tenant's immediate family or any persons living with the Tenant or any invited visitors to the Property fair wear and tear excepted and to pay to the Landlord any costs incurred by the Landlord in carrying out any works in default.
Reporting Disrepair

To report to the Landlord promptly any disrepair or defect to the Property or to any installation or furniture or equipment therein or to the common parts or the occurrence of any fire or other incident which might result in a claim being made against any insurance relating to the Property.
Access

To allow employees of the Landlord or contractors acting on their behalf access at all reasonable hours of the daytime to inspect the condition of the Property or to carry out repairs or other works to the Property or to those of an adjoining owner (normally at least 24 hours' notice will be given but access may be required immediately in an emergency) and to allow the Landlord to enter and view the Property with prospective tenants.
Assignment Lodger and Sub-Letting Not to assign the tenancy.
Not to sub-let by way of assured sub-tenancy or otherwise the whole or any part of the Property or to take in lodgers.
Not to share possession of the Property with any other person, unless this is authorised by the Landlord.
To supply information
On the request of the Landlord to provide names and ages of all persons occupying the Property
Insurance Risks

Not to keep on the Property any mobile gas heaters gas cylinders oil burning appliances paraffin or petrol or to do or allow anything on the Property which might invalidate any insurance of the Property or increase the cost of such insurance. Note that the Landlord takes no responsibility for loss or damage sustained to personal belongings during tenancy and that tenant shall obtain suitable personal contents insurance cover
Not to alter or decorate the Property
Not to alter or add to the structure of the Property not to alter nor install any further connectivity devices.
Not to carry out any decoration to the Property Common Areas
To keep any areas used in common with other persons or tenants clean and free from obstacles which might cause injury or nuisance or annoyance to others.
Refuse
To dispose of all refuse in the receptacles provided by the Landlord ensuring compliance with any recycling procedures specified by Landlord or Local Authority.
Domestic Violence

Not to do or cause to be done or threaten to do or cause to be done any act of violence which will or may be likely to prevent any person who has the right to occupy the Property from continuing peaceably to occupy them. To comply with any terms of local enforcement notice that may be issued in respect of the Property.
Regulations
To perform and observe all fire and other general regulations affecting the Property which may be determined by the Landlord
Security and Fire detection
To confirm receipt of key(s) by completing Key Receipt Form in this agreement Schedule 1
Not to change the locks or install additional locks. In the event a key is lost by the Tenant the Landlord will arrange a replacement lock and key and recharge the Tenant at cost.
Not to make further copies of keys or share keys or transfer keys without prior permission of the Landlord.
To take reasonable steps to preserve the security of the Property and of the building of which the Property forms part.
Not to fit covers over or otherwise obscure or block any automatic fire detection heads or other fire detection equipment.

Not to remove window restrictors. In line with the trust policy ground floor restrictors may be unlocked once risk assessed by the Trust Head of Health, Safety and Risk. Note: those above ground floor will not be unlocked.
Furniture and Effects
Not to remove the furniture and effects from the Property nor to install in the Property any furniture which is the Property of the Tenant or others without the consent of the Landlord.
Not to unlock or remove window restrictors without express permission from the landlord.

To leave the furniture and effects at the end of the tenancy in the rooms or places in which they were at the beginning of the tenancy as detailed in the Inventory attached to this Agreement as Schedule
Parking Area
Not to use the parking area (if any) for any purpose except the parking of a motor vehicle in private use only and not to use the area for the carrying out of repairs to any such vehicle.
Moving Out
To notify the Landlord in writing of the Tenant's intention to vacate the Property and give the Landlord vacant possession and to return the keys to the Property at the end of the tenancy.
To remove all personal possessions and rubbish and to leave the Property and the fixtures and fittings furniture and furnishings belonging to the Landlord in good repair and clean condition

To pay for any additional washing (including ironing and pressing) of all linen and for additional washing and cleaning (including ironing and pressing) of all bedding and curtains which may be required due to tenant default and which has not been catered for by payment of the service charge.

The Landlord does not accept any responsibility for anything left at the Property by the Tenant at the end of the tenancy; to hand over keys to the Landlord (or its duly appointed agent) by no later than 4 pm on the afternoon of the date of vacation.
Tenant should return the keys to the Landlord. The Landlord will confirm return by completing Key Receipt Form in this agreement as Schedule 1.
Tenant will be charged rent up to and including day of vacation.
Property left on Property after Moving Out

If after the Tenant has vacated the Property any property of the Tenant remains in or on the Property, the Landlord will use its best endeavours to contact the Tenant by telephone or in writing to request that the property is collected.
If after 7 days from the date of this request, (or attempt to request), the Tenant fails to collect their property, the Landlord may sell such property.

The Landlord shall be entitled to retain such proceeds of sale absolutely unless the Tenant shall claim them, (less reasonable costs of sale/removal), within 6 months of the date upon which the Tenant vacated the Property.

The Tenant will indemnify the Landlord against any liability incurred by it to any third party whose property shall have been sold by the Landlord in the mistaken belief held in good faith (which shall be presumed unless the contrary be proved) that such property belonged to the Tenant.

The Tenant shall indemnify the Landlord against any damages and any actions, claims, proceedings, costs, expenses and demands made against the Landlord caused by or related to the presence of the property in or on the Property.
THE PROVISOS
The Landlord may terminate this Agreement upon providing the Tenant with reasonable notice as required in accordance with the relevant legislation at the time.

The Landlord may cause the rent hereby reserved to be deducted from any wages or payment that may from time to time be due to the Tenant and if the Landlord does so the Landlord shall be entitled (notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement) to deduct payments of rent during the calendar month preceding the dates upon which the payments become due.
NOTICES

Any notice to be given to the Tenant in connection with the tenancy shall be deemed to be properly given if left or delivered by hand or sent by first class post addressed to the Tenant at the Property or (if the Tenant shall have vacated the Property and shall have notified the Landlord of a forwarding address) at such forwarding address.

Any notice to be given to the Landlord in connection with the tenancy shall be deemed to be properly given if left or delivered by hand or sent by first class post addressed for the attention of Landlord's Accommodation Manager at the Property address: […………………………………………………] or at such other address or person as may from time to time be notified to the Tenant.
A notice sent by post will be deemed served on the Landlord or Tenant on the second working day after posting so long as post is affected before 4pm.
Condition

The Tenant has been given the opportunity to inspect the Property and ancillary facilities and carried out investigations as to the condition of the same within one working day of commencement of the Agreement, and the Tenant has formed the Tenant's own view as to the condition of the Property and the ancillary facilities and their suitability and shall not raise any objection whatsoever as to the accommodation and catering facilities provided either in the Property or ancillary to the same.
TENANTS COPY

GENERAL TERMS The Payment of Rent

The payment of the Rent and any direct payment for which the Tenant is liable is due in arrears from the Tenant on each payday (determined by the Landlord for all employees), which is typically the 26th of each month or on the preceding Friday should the 26th fall on the weekend or bank holiday ( except December when payment will be made at an agreed date prior to Christmas) and shall be made by way of deduction from the Tenant's salary if employed on a fixed or permanent contract by the Landlord. If the Tenant is not
directly employed by the Landlord payment must be made by cash, cheque, standing order, debit or credit card on the appropriate day.
Changes in Rent

The Rent shall be subject to increase at the Landlord's discretion. The amount of the increase will be such sum as is stated in a notice given by the Landlord to the Tenant specifying the amount of the increase and the date from which the increase is to take effect. Reasonable notice will be provided of the intended increase.
Altering the Agreement
With the exception of any changes in the amount of Rent this agreement may only be altered by the agreement in writing of both the Tenant and the Landlord.
Services
The Landlord shall arrange the services set out in schedule 2 to this agreement Deposit

The Tenant shall pay to the Landlord a security deposit of £ [ ] on the signing of this Agreement. This deposit shall be retained by the Landlord as security for performance of the Tenant's obligations and shall be repayable to the Tenant only after the end of the tenancy and then without interest and after any deductions of any sums required to compensate the Landlord whether wholly or in part for any breach of obligation on the Tenant's part.

In this Agreement both the Landlord and the Tenant have rights and obligations which must be observed and these are specified in the attached conditions of tenancy which form part of this Agreement, although other rights and obligations may be implied by law.

The Landlord agrees to grant the Tenancy solely on these terms and subject to the conditions attached and in reliance on the statement signed by the Tenant. No other statements whether oral or written, form part of this agreement.
